topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b30e6463687246b800100c#post_55b30e6463687246b800100c
[bq="mariomarc"]!http://40.media.tumblr.com/8686365ceb99c4a14fa3b19e4ffb1736/tumblr_nrzxgqO9hV1s1p14ao1_1280.jpg!

"Source":http://www.washingtonpost.com/local/frigid-offices-freezing-women-oblivious-men-an-air-conditioning-investigation/2015/07/23/bdd1b4b4-30ae-11e5-97ae-30a30cca95d7_story.html
[/bq]
The word "sexism" has just been relegated to a cheap name calling tactic to complain about things the person doesn't like.

It's the modern day equivalent of calling someone a "nerd", back in the day that word was a serious insult and you would get a busted jaw; very few people give a fuck about the word as a insult.

Bloody used to mean "damn".

Fuck used to be a serious swear word, but I hear that word like forty fucking times in walmart during shopping.

. . . Etc, etc, etc.

I think there was a south park episode about this sort of things where people started using swear words so often it summoned a eldritch monster or something.

topics.body: Seriously, it's hard to insult people nowadays, when a lot of words are becoming less offensive
topics.author: 4fe3df367f123b517900066a

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b31747636872744a000973#post_55b31747636872744a000973
Swearing now is more about what social circle you move in than actually offending anyone. I for instance don't swear nearly as much here as I do in meat space. I mean I just wrote to whole sentences without using the word "fuck" once where as when I'm speaking I basically use it as a fucking comma.

Although when it comes to the "sexism" thing I think a better comparison is the word "fascist" which is rarely ever used to describe someone's actual political philosophy so much as it is used to simply attack anyone you disagree with who takes a more authoritarian approach. See also comparisons to Nazis, communists, anarchists and so on.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

Swearing now is more about what social circle you move in than actually offending anyone. I for instance don't swear nearly as much here as I do in meat space. I mean I just wrote to whole sentences without using the word "fuck" once where as when I'm speaking I basically use it as a fucking comma.

Although when it comes to the "sexism" thing I think a better comparison is the word "fascist" which is rarely ever used to describe someone's actual political philosophy so much as it is used to simply attack anyone you disagree with who takes a more authoritarian approach. See also comparisons to Nazis, communists, anarchists and so on.[/bq]
You have to admit it's going to be funny when people become desensitized to these words.
